jNotes.questionText: Who is elected in the European election?
jNotes.answer2: The countries allowed to join the EU
jNotes.answer3: The members of the European Parliament

The then French President François Mitterrand and the then German Chancellor Helmut Kohl commemorate the dead of both World Wars together in Verdun. Which goal of the European Union becomes clear at this meeting?
jNotes.answer2: Freedom of travel in all EU countries
jNotes.answer3: Peace and security in the countries of the EU
jNotes.answer4: Uniform public holidays in the countries of the EU

jNotes.questionText: How many member states does the EU have today?

jNotes.answer2: Founding of the European Economic Community (EEC)
jNotes.answer3: Germany's obligation to make reparation payments
jNotes.answer4: Determination of the Oder-Neisse line as the eastern border

jNotes.questionText: In which places does the European Parliament work?
Through which treaties did the Federal Republic of Germany join with other states to form the European Economic Community?
Since when have people in Germany paid with the Euro in cash?
Ms. Seger is having a child. What must she do to receive parental allowance (Elterngeld)?
jNotes.answer1: She must write to her health insurance company.
jNotes.answer2: She must submit an application to the parental allowance office.
jNotes.answer3: She doesn't have to do anything because she automatically receives parental allowance.
jNotes.answer4: She must ask the employment agency for permission.

jNotes.questionText: Who decides whether a child goes to kindergarten in Germany?
Maik and Sybille want to hold a demonstration on the street with friends at their place of residence in Germany. What must they do beforehand?
jNotes.answer2: They don't have to do anything. You can demonstrate anywhere anytime in Germany.
jNotes.answer3: They can't do anything because demonstrations are generally forbidden in Germany.
jNotes.answer4: Maik and Sybille must found a new club because only clubs are allowed to demonstrate.

jNotes.questionText: Which school leaving certificate do you usually need to start studying at a university in Germany?
Who is NOT allowed to live together as a couple in Germany?
From what age is one of legal age in Germany?

The upbringing of children is primarily the task of ... in Germany.
Who is mainly responsible for child-rearing in Germany?
In Germany, you have the best chances for a well-paid job if you...
jNotes.answer4: are a member of a party.

jNotes.questionText: If you hit a child in Germany...
jNotes.answer3: you cannot be punished for it.
jNotes.answer4: you can be punished for it.

jNotes.questionText: In Germany...
jNotes.answer1: you may only be married to one partner at the same time.
jNotes.answer2: you can have several spouses at the same time.
jNotes.answer3: you may not marry again if you were once married.
jNotes.answer4: a woman may not marry again if her husband has died.

jNotes.questionText: Where do you have to register if you move within Germany?
In Germany, married couples are allowed to divorce. Mostly they have to observe the 'separation year'. What does that mean?
jNotes.answer1: The divorce process takes one year.
jNotes.answer2: The spouses have been married for one year, then divorce is possible.
jNotes.answer3: Visitation rights for the children apply for one year.
jNotes.answer4: The spouses live their own lives separately for at least one year. After that, divorce is possible.

jNotes.questionText: In case of educational problems, parents in Germany can receive help from the...

jNotes.answer3: Approval from the resident registration office

jNotes.questionText: An adult woman wants to catch up on her Abitur in Germany. She can do this at...
What is the youth welfare office (Jugendamt) allowed to do in Germany?
jNotes.answer1: It decides which school the child attends.
jNotes.answer2: It can take a child who is beaten or starving out of the family.
jNotes.answer3: It pays child benefit to the parents.
jNotes.answer4: It checks whether the child attends a kindergarten.

jNotes.questionText: The Career Information Center (BIZ) at the Federal Employment Agency in Germany helps with...

jNotes.answer1: the right to unlimited free time.
jNotes.answer2: freedom of choice for all subjects.

jNotes.questionText: A man wants to catch up on his Abitur in Germany at the age of 30. Where can he do that? At...
What does the principle of equal treatment mean in Germany?
jNotes.answer1: No one may be disadvantaged, e.g., because of a disability.
jNotes.answer2: You may disadvantage other people if sufficient personal reasons exist for this.
jNotes.answer3: No one may sue persons if they have been disadvantaged.
jNotes.answer4: It is law for everyone to donate money annually to disadvantaged groups.

jNotes.questionText: In Germany, young people are criminally responsible from the age of 14. This means: Young people who are 14 years and older and violate criminal laws...
jNotes.answer3: share the punishment with their parents.

jNotes.questionText: For which festival do people wear colorful costumes and masks in Germany?
Where must you go first in Germany if you want to get married?

jNotes.answer2: When the neighbors go to sleep

jNotes.questionText: A young woman in Germany, 22 years old, lives with her boyfriend. The woman's parents do not like this because they do not like the boyfriend. What can the parents do?
jNotes.answer1: They must respect the decision of the adult daughter.
jNotes.answer2: They have the right to bring the daughter back to the parental apartment.
jNotes.answer3: They can go to the police and report the daughter.
jNotes.answer4: They look for another man for the daughter.

jNotes.questionText: A young woman wants to get a driver's license. She is afraid of the exam because her native language is not German. What is correct?
jNotes.answer1: She must live in Germany for at least ten years before she can get a driver's license.
jNotes.answer2: If she cannot speak German, she is not allowed to have a driver's license.
jNotes.answer3: She must get the driver's license in the country where her language is spoken.
jNotes.answer4: She can perhaps take the theory exam in her native language. There are more than ten languages to choose from.

jNotes.answer2: a place in a sports club.
